poem:
"Tax Haven Havoc"

Barclay twins, in shadows cast,
Lobbied Labour, fast and fast,
Inheritance tax, they wished to blast,
Selfish profit, unsurpassed.

Telegraph kings, with fortunes vast,
Spectator owners, unsurpassed.
The cabinet files, now unmasked,
Reveal the lobby, unsurpassed.

But oh, the irony, at last,
Their request in ocean vast.
Money soaked, in tax-free cast,
A greedy song, forever broadcast.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling humorous. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
